intro: Astragalus sharestanicus, commonly known as the Karakoram milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. Astragalus sharestanicus plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems in its native habitat.
